citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein is essential for replication of the chromosome. It is also involved in DNA recombination and repair

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds specifically to the ssrA RNA (tmRNA) and is required for stable association of ssrA with ribosomes

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the desulfonation of aliphatic sulfonates
An alkanesufonate (R-CH(2)-SO(3)H) + FMNH(2) + O(2) = an aldehyde (R-CHO) + FMN + sulfite + H(2)O

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Probably forms a two-component reduced flavin mononucleotide-dependent monooxygenase by binding to ssuD. Required for growth on aliphatic sulfonates or methionine but not arylsulfonates

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Conversion of NADPH, generated by peripheral catabolic pathways, to NADH, which can enter the respiratory chain for energy generation
Belongs to the class-I pyridine nucleotide-disulfide oxidoreductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Nucleotidase that shows phosphatase activity on nucleoside 5'-monophosphates
Binds 1 divalent metal cation per subunit
Belongs to the surE nucleotidase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-alanine + tRNA(Ala) = AMP + diphosphate + L-alanyl-tRNA(Ala)
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-cysteine + tRNA(Cys) = AMP + diphosphate + L-cysteinyl-tRNA(Cys)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-aspartate + tRNA(Asp) = AMP + diphosphate + L-aspartyl-tRNA(Asp)
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-glutamate + tRNA(Glu) = AMP + diphosphate + L-glutamyl-tRNA(Glu)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-phenylalanine + tRNA(Phe) = AMP + diphosphate + L-phenylalanyl-tRNA(Phe)
Tetramer of two alpha and two beta chains
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family. Phe-tRNA synthetase alpha chain type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-phenylalanine + tRNA(Phe) = AMP + diphosphate + L-phenylalanyl-tRNA(Phe)
Tetramer of two alpha and two beta chains
Belongs to the phenylalanyl-tRNA synthetase beta chain family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + glycine + tRNA(Gly) = AMP + diphosphate + glycyl-tRNA(Gly)
Tetramer of two alpha and two beta chains
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + glycine + tRNA(Gly) = AMP + diphosphate + glycyl-tRNA(Gly)
Tetramer of two alpha and two beta chains
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-histidine + tRNA(His) = AMP + diphosphate + L-histidyl-tRNA(His)
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the attachment of isoleucine to tRNA(Ile). As IleRS can inadvertently accomodate and process structurally similar amino acids such as valine, to avoid such errors it has two additional distinct tRNA(Ile)-dependent editing activities. One activity is designated as 'pretransfer' editing and involves the hydrolysis of activated Val-AMP. The other activity is designated 'posttransfer' editing and involves deacylation of mischarged Val-tRNA(Ile)
ATP + L-isoleucine + tRNA(Ile) = AMP + diphosphate + L-isoleucyl-tRNA(Ile)

IleRS has two distinct active sites: one for aminoacylation and one for editing. The misactivated valine is translocated from the active site to the editing site, which sterically excludes the correctly activated isoleucine. The single editing site contains two valyl binding pockets, one specific for each substrate (Val-AMP or Val-tRNA(Ile))
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family. IleS type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-lysine + tRNA(Lys) = AMP + diphosphate + L-lysyl-tRNA(Lys)
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-leucine + tRNA(Leu) = AMP + diphosphate + L-leucyl-tRNA(Leu)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Is required not only for elongation of protein synthesis but also for the initiation of all mRNA translation through initiator tRNA(fMet) aminoacylation
ATP + L-methionine + tRNA(Met) = AMP + diphosphate + L-methionyl-tRNA(Met)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family. MetG type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-glutamine + tRNA(Gln) = AMP + diphosphate + L-glutaminyl-tRNA(Gln)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-arginine + tRNA(Arg) = AMP + diphosphate + L-arginyl-tRNA(Arg)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-serine + tRNA(Ser) = AMP + diphosphate + L-seryl-tRNA(Ser)
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-threonine + tRNA(Thr) = AMP + diphosphate + L-threonyl-tRNA(Thr)
Belongs to the class-II aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + L-tryptophan + tRNA(Trp) = AMP + diphosphate + L-tryptophyl-tRNA(Trp)
Belongs to the class-I aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Transaldolase is important for the balance of metabolites in the pentose-phosphate pathway
Belongs to the transaldolase family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex tauABC involved in taurine import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + taurine(Out) = ADP + phosphate + taurine(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (tauB), two transmembrane proteins (tauC) and a solute-binding protein (tauA)
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Taurine importer (TC 3.A.1.17.1) subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Exchanges the guanine residue with 7-aminomethyl-7-deazaguanine in tRNAs with GU(N) anticodons (tRNA-Asp, -Asn, -His and -Tyr). After this exchange, a cyclopentendiol moiety is attached to the 7-aminomethyl group of 7-deazaguanine, resulting in the hypermodified nucleoside queuosine (Q) (7-(((4,5-cis-dihydroxy-2-cyclopenten-1-yl)amino)methyl)-7-deazaguanosine)
tRNA guanine + queuine = tRNA queuine + guanine
Belongs to the queuine tRNA-ribosyltransferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Required for the synthesis of the hydromethylpyrimidine (HMP) moiety of thiamine (4-amino-2-methyl-5-hydroxymethylpyrimidine)
Cofactor biosynthesis; thiamine-PP biosynthesis; 4-amino-2-methyl-5-diphosphomethylpyrimidine from 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole: step 1

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Condenses 4-methyl-5-(beta-hydroxyethyl)thiazole monophosphate (THZ-P) and 4-amino-5-hydroxymethyl pyrimidine pyrophosphate (HMP-PP) to form thiamine monophosphate (TMP)
Cofactor biosynthesis; thiamine-PP biosynthesis; thiamine pyrophosphate from 4-amino-2-methyl-5-diphosphomethylpyrimidine and 4-methyl-5-(2-phosphoethyl)thiazole: step 1

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Required for the synthesis of the thiazole moiety of thiamine

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Required for the synthesis of the thiazole moiety

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in protein export. Acts as a chaperone by maintaining the newly synthesized protein in an open conformation
Belongs to the FKBP-type PPIase family. Tig subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Ligates lysine onto the cytidine present at position 34 of the AUA codon-specific tRNA(Ile) that contains the anticodon CAU, in an ATP-dependent manner. Cytidine is converted to lysidine, thus changing the amino acid specificity of the tRNA from methionine to isoleucine
The N-terminal region contains the highly conserved SGGXDS motif, predicted to be a P-loop motif involved in ATP binding
Belongs to the tRNA(Ile)-lysidine synthase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the tonB-independent uptake of proteins

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Plays an important role in several metabolic pathways
Belongs to the triosephosphate isomerase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: S-adenosyl-L-methionine + a thiopurine = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + a thiopurine S-methylether
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. TPMT family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the formation of 5-methyl-uridine at position 54 (M-5-U54) in all tRNA
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + tRNA = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + tRNA containing thymine
Belongs to the RNA M5U methyltransferase family. TrmA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the formation of N(7)-methylguanine at position 46 (m7G46) in tRNA
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + tRNA = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + tRNA containing N(7)-methylguanine
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. TrmB family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Specifically methylates guanosine-37 in various tRNAs
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + tRNA = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + tRNA containing N(1)-methylguanine
Belongs to the RNA methyltransferase trmD family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Exhibits a very high intrinsic GTPase hydrolysis rate. Involved in the biosynthesis of the hypermodified nucleoside 5-methylaminomethyl-2-thiouridine, which is found in the wobble position of some tRNAs
Belongs to the era/trmE GTP-binding protein family. TrmE subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The alpha subunit is responsible for the aldol cleavage of indoleglycerol phosphate to indole and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-tryptophan biosynthesis; L-tryptophan from chorismate: step 5 [final step]
Tetramer of two alpha and two beta chains

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The beta subunit is responsible for the synthesis of L-tryptophan from indole and L-serine
Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-tryptophan biosynthesis; L-tryptophan from chorismate: step 5 [final step]
Tetramer of two alpha and two beta chains

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-tryptophan biosynthesis; L-tryptophan from chorismate: step 4

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-tryptophan biosynthesis; L-tryptophan from chorismate: step 2
Belongs to the anthranilate phosphoribosyltransferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-tryptophan biosynthesis; L-tryptophan from chorismate: step 3

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Responsible for synthesis of pseudouridine from uracil-13 in transfer RNAs
Belongs to the pseudouridine synthase truD family

protein.name: Probable efflux pump periplasmic linker ttgA precursor

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Extremophiles
citation.title: Comparative genomic analysis of solvent extrusion pumps in Pseudomonas strains exhibiting different degrees of solvent tolerance.

comment.text: Probable periplasmic linker protein component of the ttgABC efflux pump with unknown specificity
Attached to the inner membrane by a lipid anchor
Belongs to the membrane fusion protein (MFP) (TC 8.A.1) family

There are 4 nearly identical operons in various strains of P.putida. The ttgABC operon of strain DOT-T1E and the mepABC operon of strain KT2442-TOL function in solvent and antibiotic efflux; however in strain S12 the arpABC operon functions only in antibiotic efflux. This may be due to different protein expression levels. In KT2400 this operon does not seem to function in toluene efflux

feature.description: Probable efflux pump periplasmic linker ttgA

protein.name: Probable efflux pump membrane transporter ttgB

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Extremophiles
citation.title: Comparative genomic analysis of solvent extrusion pumps in Pseudomonas strains exhibiting different degrees of solvent tolerance.

comment.text: Probable membrane transporter component of the ttgABC efflux pump with unknown specificity

There are 4 nearly identical operons in various strains of P.putida. The ttgABC operon of strain DOT-T1E and the mepABC operon of strain KT2442-TOL function in solvent and antibiotic efflux; however in strain S12 the arpABC operon functions only in antibiotic efflux. This may be due to different protein expression levels. In KT2400 this operon does not seem to function in toluene efflux

feature.description: Probable efflux pump membrane transporter ttgB

protein.name: Probable efflux pump outer membrane protein ttgC precursor

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Extremophiles
citation.title: Comparative genomic analysis of solvent extrusion pumps in Pseudomonas strains exhibiting different degrees of solvent tolerance.

comment.text: Probable outer membrane component of the ttgABC efflux pump with unknown specificity
Attached to the outer membrane by a lipid anchor
Belongs to the outer membrane factor (OMF) (TC 1.B.17) family

There are 4 nearly identical operons in various strains of P.putida. The ttgABC operon of strain DOT-T1E and the mepABC operon of strain KT2442-TOL function in solvent and antibiotic efflux; however in strain S12 the arpABC operon functions only in antibiotic efflux. This may be due to different protein expression levels. In KT2400 this operon does not seem to function in toluene efflux

feature.description: Probable efflux pump outer membrane protein ttgC

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Probable regulatory protein for the ttgABC efflux pump operon. May function as a repressor

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Provides the sole de novo source of dTMP for DNA biosynthesis
Belongs to the thymidylate synthase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Methyltransferase required for the conversion of dimethylmenaquinone (DMKH2) to menaquinone (MKH2) and the conversion of 2-polyprenyl-6-methoxy-1,4-benzoquinol (DDMQH2) to 2-polyprenyl-3-methyl-6-methoxy-1,4-benzoquinol (DMQH2)
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. UbiE family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. UbiG/COQ3 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Excises uracil residues from the DNA which can arise as a result of misincorporation of dUMP residues by DNA polymerase or due to deamination of cytosine
Belongs to the uracil-DNA glycosylase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the dephosphorylation of undecaprenyl diphosphate (UPP). Confers resistance to bacitracin
Undecaprenyl diphosphate + H(2)O = undecaprenyl phosphate + phosphate
Bacitracin is thought to be involved in the inhibition of peptidoglycan synthesis by sequestering undecaprenyl diphosphate, thereby reducing the pool of lipid carrier available

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Generates undecaprenyl pyrophosphate (UPP) from isopentenyl pyrophosphate (IPP). UPP is the precursor of glycosyl carrier lipid in the biosynthesis of bacterial cell wall polysaccharide components such as peptidoglycan and lipopolysaccharide
Di-trans,poly-cis-decaprenyl diphosphate + isopentenyl diphosphate = diphosphate + di-trans,poly-cis-undecaprenyl diphosphate
Belongs to the UPP synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the urease gamma subunit family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The UvrABC repair system catalyzes the recognition and processing of DNA lesions. UvrA is an ATPase and a DNA-binding protein. A damage recognition complex composed of 2 uvrA and 2 uvrB subunits scans DNA for abnormalities. When the presence of a lesion has been verified by uvrB, the uvrA molecules dissociate
Forms a heterotetramer with uvrB during the search for lesions
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. UvrA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The UvrABC repair system catalyzes the recognition and processing of DNA lesions. UvrC both incises the 5' and 3' sides of the lesion. The N-terminal half is responsible for the 3' incision and the C-terminal half is responsible for the 5' incision
Interacts with uvrB in an incision complex

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Site-specific tyrosine recombinase, which acts by catalyzing the cutting and rejoining of the recombining DNA molecules. The xerC-xerD complex is essential to convert dimers of the bacterial chromosome into monomers to permit their segregation at cell division. It also contributes to the segregational stability of plasmids
Forms a cyclic heterotetrameric complex composed of two molecules of xerC and two molecules of xerD
Belongs to the "phage" integrase family. XerC type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Site-specific tyrosine recombinase, which acts by catalyzing the cutting and rejoining of the recombining DNA molecules. The xerC-xerD complex is essential to convert dimers of the bacterial chromosome into monomers to permit their segregation at cell division. It also contributes to the segregational stability of plasmids
Forms a cyclic heterotetrameric complex composed of two molecules of xerC and two molecules of xerD
Belongs to the "phage" integrase family. XerD type 1 subfamily

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Interacts directly with the cell division protein ftsZ. Probable receptor for the septal ring structure, may anchor it to the inner-membrane
